note.p: Historian. BA (classics), Cambridge (Christ’s College), 1852–7; fellow, 1857–9. Chief classical assistant master, City of London School, 1859–63. Professor of Latin, University College London, 1863. Increasingly challenged the educational dominance of Greek and Latin. Aspired to establish a new ‘science of politics’ based on his notion of history as a national medium of social morality. Regius professor of modern history at Cambridge, 1869–95. An acclaimed and popular lecturer. Knighted 1894.
